bio.experienceSummary: I am a PhD candidate in clinical psychology, specializing in childhood and adolescence and love working with children of all ages and their families. I am looking for part-time work to help support me through graduate school. In addition to my professional training working with kids, I have over 15 years of babysitting experience. I am eager, flexible, and creative and would love to work with you and your family.

Hi! I grew up in the Upper West Side of Manhattan, attended the Dalton School, Columbia and NYU. I have worked with children in London, Paris, Barcalona, and New York City, for over 20 years. With my experience, I have the unique skill set to work with a diverse population of all ages, ethnic backgrounds, and abilities.

My clientele include families with children attending, or applying to, Dalton, Epiphany, Trevor, and the Quad, or simply visiting the city for a holiday. I have personally stayed in touch with some of my roll models from Dalton for many year's, and hope to impact children to the same extent that my former teachers have had on myself. 

I give private lessons, offer homework help, and work on behavioral issues. I love seeing 'my' kids grow, expand their horizons, and learn to relish NYC as their own backyard. I enjoy taking children on field trips to museums and cultural events as much as to the playground.

I often find myself working with families for multiple years.

description.displayText: Melissa is my wonderful neighbor who regularly checks in with my 19 month old daughter. She has given us lovely educational books, toys and crafts that we have had so much fun with. I see Melissa with her 5 year old niece all the time and they have a great time rehearsing for music and dance recitals together. Melissa loves children and is very knowledgeable about age-appropriate creative and engaging activities. We are so lucky to know her.
description.originalText: Melissa is my wonderful neighbor who regularly checks in with my 19 month old daughter. She has given us lovely educational books, toys and crafts that we have had so much fun with. I see Melissa with her 5 year old niece all the time and they have a great time rehearsing for music and dance recitals together. Melissa loves children and is very knowledgeable about age-appropriate creative and engaging activities. We are so lucky to know her.

bio.experienceSummary:
Patient, Empathetic, & Energetic! 

I have over 6 years experience in being a childcare provider, and dedicate myself to being an advocate for each child's holistic wellbeing. 

I have experience working with children ages 18mo-15yo, as well as experience caring for up to 6 children at a time. I also have experience with potty training! 

I have previously tutored English and non/English speaking students in Language Arts, Writing, and Math. 

I have extensive experience volunteering at youth-centred organisations, especially ones serving economically disadvantaged and marginalised kids. I've also worked with children on the Autism spectrum, and always accommodate my care to the specific needs of each child. 

In efforts to work at Afterschool programs, I have also received certification for Infant & Young Children's Development and Safety, as well as training to be a mandated reporter.


I am very reliable and always easy to reach. I'd love to see if I'm a good fit for your family :)

description.originalText: Laure came to our rescue when we needed last-minute care for our kids over the summer. Each day she managed to fill a full 8 hours with laughter, fun, and creativity. She was very calm and patient with the kids, highly responsive, and highly responsible and dependable. Would recommend her to anyone. We'll definitely be working with her again!

bio.experienceSummary: I love working with children but am thinking about leaving the bedside for awhile and babysitting again. My rate is $75/hr but you will not find anyone more qualified or better for your children. I have been a pediatric ICU nurse for 4 years and know how to react and remain calm in emergencies and quickly gain the trust of new children. I have cared for preemies all the way to teenagers. I was a lifeguard and swim instructor in college. I have a small 4 door car and a perfect driving record. I don't smoke and love to be outside. I am working 3 12hr shifts/week until mid June but then will have a free schedule for the next two months. Fully vaccinated. Ready to cook clean and do whatever is needed in the house.

I am fantastic with children and have always had a special desire in making sure they grow up to live healthy, enriching lives. I am babysitting on the side to earn additional income while full time job hunting.

*Vaccinated and boosted for covid*

Hi there!

I am 36 years old am originally from Madison, Wisconsin, but have lived in Berlin, D. C., Oakland, and different parts of France before moving to Brooklyn in 2021 to pursue my MSW (my full-time work is in mental health). 

I have 20+ years of child care experience and care for children from newborn to 17 years old. I am proud to say that I have been numerous families' first nanny, most having infants around 4 to 6-months-old when I started working for them. I specialize in caring for babies through age 7, but love to care for children of all ages.

My passions include traveling, social justice, and dancing. I love to explore and play outside, do arts and crafts activities, and spend time reading with the children I care for. I am proficient in French and Spanish.

Although I do not have a car of my own, I would be happy to drive your children if you have a car to provide. I look forward to meeting you and caring for your children!

description.originalText: Amazing, caring, bubbly, great care for our two toddlers

bio.experienceSummary: My first experience caring for children was when I was 13 years old I volunteered at my local Children's Hospital outpatient center and spent my summer caring for children with mental and physical disabilities. Since then, I have nannied for several infants & children throughout high school, college and grad school. My most long-term caregiving experience involved caring for a student at the George Washington University with spinal muscular atrophy: I helped with physical therapy, provided safe transport, administered medication, performed physical therapy, and did daily/nightly housework. In college, I was a licensed EMS provider and worked on the George Washington University EMS unit. I am also certified in CPR-pro. I continued to nanny while working full-time out east in the Hamptons. Since then, I have moved to Brooklyn and just finished my Master's of Science in TCM. I am currently studying for my board exams and looking for part-time nannying positions for the remainder of 2024.

A dedicated nanny with a Bachelor's degree in Education and over 11 years of experience in teaching and childcare. Having previously owned my own daycare, I understand the importance of creating a nurturing and stimulating environment for children.

I pride myself on being fun, creative, and hands-on in my approach. I love to engage kids with interactive activities that promote learning and spark their imaginations. From arts and crafts to outdoor adventures, I ensure everyday is filled with joy and love. 

I'm excited about the opportunity to support your family and provide a loving, enriching experience for your child. Let's connect and make wonderful memories together!

description.displayText: Keiana comes to work early and is very dedicated. She is bubbly and my infant triplets love her. She is very active and gets on the floor to talk and play with them. You can see how much she loves kids. She fits in like one of the family members. I also love the fact she doesn't believe in watching lots of TV so she is more hands on.
description.originalText: Keiana comes to work early and is very dedicated. She is bubbly and my infant triplets love her. She is very active and gets on the floor to talk and play with them. You can see how much she loves kids. She fits in like one of the family members. I also love the fact she doesn't believe in watching lots of TV so she is more hands on.

bio.experienceSummary:
Experienced Childcare Provider & School Psychologist Available for Afternoons, Evenings, and Weekends

With over 15 years of experience in childcare, including working in schools and summer camps, I bring a deep passion for nurturing and mentoring children of all ages. I am currently a full-time school psychologist, entering my seventh year in this role, and I am looking to extend my services to families in need of reliable and caring support outside of school hours.

I specialize in providing positive role modeling for young girls, mentoring teens and middle school children, and offering school-age children pick-up and drop-off services after school. Additionally, I am skilled in hair care services, with over 15 years of experience. I also teach dance and step.

I am extremely personable, love engaging in fun activities, going on adventures, and exploring new experiences with children.

description.originalText: Tamara is amazing with young children! Her patience, creativity, and genuine care make her a standout. The kids absolutely love spending time with her, and she always ensures they are engaged and happy. Highly recommend her!

bio.experienceSummary:
My name is Darby, and I'm excited to connect with a new family in the city as I pursue a PhD in Psychology. I'm a 28-year-old professional, live in West Village, and graduated Summa Cum Laude from Wake Forest University in 2019.
My childcare approach is more than supervision- it's about fostering a warm, encouraging environment where kindness and growth thrive. I believe in being a role model & trusted companion for the kids I care for, blending fun with learning in a way that feels authentic, effortless & engaging.
Over the years, parents have consistently recognized that my experience, loyalty, love & dedication offer far more than standard childcare. I strive to be an integral part of your family's support system, providing a level of care & attention that aligns with your family needs and values. 
I understand the dynamic & hectic pace of life in NYC, so my goal is to be a steady, joyful presence in your household, helping your kids thrive while making your life a little easier.

description.originalText: Darby has been an awesome addition to our family dynamic. She helps with diapers for the little guy and chemistry homework for my teen in the same swoop. She is so fricken sweet and gentle as a person. Every time things get calm she finds me and asks “what can I do to help?” Or “what can I take off your plate today?” What a fricken godsend and smart as a whip too!
